The Hiring Agreement section states that the Contractor agrees to execute and comply with the Maryland Department of Human Resources Hiring Agreement. This agreement must be executed by the Bidder/Offeror and delivered to the Procurement Officer within ten business days after the Bidder/Offeror is recommended for contract award. top_red_flags.title: Modification and Payment Limitations
top_red_flags.why_it_matters: The contract states that payment will not exceed a certain amount unless modified. This means there is a risk for financial overrun if not managed properly.

evidence.quote: payment to the Contractor pursuant to this Contract, including the base term and any option exercised by the State, shall not exceed $ ().

top_red_flags.suggested_action: Clarify the financial limit and ensure there is a mechanism for amendment to avoid service interruptions.

top_red_flags.title: Rights to Records and Intellectual Property
top_red_flags.why_it_matters: The contract assigns all rights to the State which may limit the contractor's future usage of the developed materials.

evidence.quote: all documents and materials...shall be the sole property of the State and shall be available to the State at any time.

top_red_flags.suggested_action: Negotiate terms that allow the contractor some retention of rights or benefits from the developed materials or propose royalty terms.

top_red_flags.title: Indemnification Clause
top_red_flags.why_it_matters: The contractor is required to indemnify the State broadly, which could pose a significant liability risk.

evidence.quote: The Contractor shall hold harmless and indemnify the State from...any and all losses, damages, claims, suits, actions...

top_red_flags.suggested_action: Define indemnification limits and ensure proper insurance is in place to cover potential liabilities.
